text: you know actually we were a very small
company when I came on the scene in ' 67
it's about $2 million a year it we we
were called Western India vegetable
products Limited at that time we were in
cooking fats crushing oil seeds and we
continued with that business but we
moved it from being a commodity business
to being a branded business in 76 IBM
exited the country uh and IBM had
dominant market share in Information
Technology products in India and we saw
an opportunity coming up there and we
were looking for a high-tech
diversification which had an annity
service Revenue so we put an act
together and launched a microprocessor
base multi-tasking multi-user computer
system in 1980 and it was immensely
successful because we invested a huge
amount in R&D a huge amount in software
services and software support services
and software Solutions and there was no
looking back after that and then we
gradually uh grew that business to
address Global customers in services but
that point of time uh we were quite a
profitable vegetable oil company and we
had strong reserves and therefore we
were capable of leveraging part of those
reserves and our Equity to do some
borrowing but we started small but we
were profitable from from year one and
we've plowed back all our profits in
terms of future growth
now we have recently used all the wide
spaces of our businesses to launch a
business in Eco energy where basically
we offer consultancy services to our
clients focused currently on India but
uh quickly on our large Global clients
where we are able to analyze the energy
requirements tell them how they could
significantly save on it systems
integrate and systems engineer a
solution Implement that solution and
maintain that solution solution so it is
going to potentially be a very large
business for us going forward because we
have a first mover advantage in
it one most important it must be a
business which we can do ethically
without compromising on Integrity some
businesses across the globe require too
much quid pro cuse Vis of is being
successful in them and we're not willing
to do those quit procos which are
unethical second is a very clear
criteria that we must achieve leadership
in that business and when I say
leadership we must be in the top three
in that business in terms of a market
positioning partnership with the
customer choice of the customer as well
as
size and three it must be a business
which gives us annuity revenues which
are of a recovering nature because that
gives stability to our
company well many years back many many
years back we entered the financial
services business
and we realized it was a wrong business
to get into and we exited that business
but we fulfilled every commitment of
ours to our lenders and borrowers in
that business even though that cost us
substantially we also entered the Doom
business at one stage with an address to
the consumer and we quickly realized
it's not a kind of business we could
make a long-term annity out of and we
exited that business
